full_text: @inkling_micko @greenparty_ie Thanks for your message. We will invest ‚Ç¨600m in safe cycle lanes by ring-fencing carbon tax, on top of 200km of dedicated cycle lanes to be delivered under bus connects. We will invest over ‚Ç¨8 billion in public transport, including investment in metro and bus. Thanks

Lots of effort went into creating a cross-party consensus on the carbon tax. It is crucial to ensuring we meet our climate targets. Disappointing to see that consensus being undermined @greenparty_ie #rtept
You can read about our plan to crack down on waste & litter and promote biodiversity here https://t.co/MhwYWqnOtv via @FineGael

Number Of House Completions Last Year Reach Highest Level In A Decade https://t.co/olHjrVB6ZZ

We will upgrade 500,000 homes to make them warmer and more energy efficient. We will group homes together to drive down costs, develop lower cost green loans and easy pay back models. We will phase out the installation of oil and gas boilers in all new homes.

We will ring fence 10% of carbon tax receipts for cycling and active travel. That‚Äôll be a ‚Ç¨600m investment. Bus connects will deliver 200km dedicated cycle lanes. This is on top of over ‚Ç¨100m being invested by the dept of transport. We want to double the number of cyclists
70% renewable electricity is at the heart of our Climate Action Plan. https://t.co/j28O1cIIZG

We will deliver high speed broadband to every home, school, farm and business in the country. That‚Äôs 1.1 million people. Essential to give rural Ireland the same opportunities as our towns and cities. Essential for job creation https://t.co/j9y1862eg6

As the first ever Minister for disabilities he brought a real change to people‚Äôs lives.  He was always a loyal colleague and at all times treated both supporters and opponents with fairness and respect.

I would like to wish my colleague Finian McGrath well. He has served our constituents well and been great to work with in and out of government. His big heart, his playful personality,and his huge commitment enlivened many a cabinet meeting. 1/2 https://t.co/3Yy8ebTaoS
800,000 electric cars to be sold in Europe by the end of the year, up 60% from 2019.  Cheaper Batteries, More Chargers for Electric Car Buyers in 2020 https://t.co/0ByT8WvmPY
Climate Action Plan sets out actions needed to deliver 70% renewable electricity by 2030 https://t.co/YWHELXZhJI

The online safety commissioner will have the power to: - decide the appropriate reporting requirements of compliance with online safety codes - request information from online services about about their compliance with the online safety codes - audit the complaints

The new Online Safety Code will address:  - cyber bullying, promoting eating disorders, self-harm & suicide - enduring complaint procedures are effective where people can request material is taken down
This new law is one of the first of its kind in the works and is breaking new ground in terms of how online services will be required to deal with harmful content

The new online safety bill is the start of a new era of accountability. It sets out clear expectations for online services who will have to comply with binding safety codes made by an Online Safety Commissioner who will have significant powers to sanction companies
The era for self-regulation online is over. Digital technology has transformed every aspect of our lives and we must put in place measures to protect our children online

Will be on @morningireland & @BreakfastNT shortly on the governments new online safety law. Online services will be required to operate safety codes, overseen by a Commissioner with financial sanctions for non-compliance. We are determined to do more to protect children online
Delighted to have the first cabinet meeting of 2020 in Dublin Bay North this morning https://t.co/a6ExeErwwo

The Climate Action Bill will also: - set a decarbonisation target range for each sector - ban the sale of fossil fuel cars by 2030  We must act now to ensure we leave a better, healthier, more sustainable Ireland for future generations. Accountability is key to achieving this.

The Climate Action Bill will create a framework for our all of government climate action plan. The bill will enshrine in law:   - our 2050 emissions reduction target; - make carbon budgets a legal requirement - strengthen the role of the Climate Action Council
https://t.co/u6G0XUrM2Q

Very sad the hear of Marian Finucane‚Äôs passing. She will be missed on our airwaves for championing change in society, her interest and skill at listening as an interviewer and her unique ability to read song lyrics. She truly was one of the best in broadcast. RIP
Looks great! https://t.co/2yvmOHkONN
Poor waste segregation and illegal dumping are other key targets. We must act now

I am determined to address how we manage our waste as part of the government‚Äôs Climate Action Plan. We must radically change our wasteful use of precious resources that damage our climate. Key targets are plastic waste, food waste, single use waste -fast fashion, plastic straws,
Over 200kg of waste packaging, 59kg of which is plastic is generated per person every years in Ireland - this is too high!
Great sing song with Santy, the Garda Band and all the students from Darndale Junior School https://t.co/zQDHiRfEFL

Many of the actions in the Climate Action Plan, such as our plan for a new National Programme for Housing upgrades, will reduce reliance on solid fuels.We will ensure that 500,000 homes are upgraded in the coming decade, with 600,000 renewable heating systems/heat pumps installed
The towns are: Cavan Town, Cobh, Midleton and Mallow Killarney, Longford Town, Castlebar, Ballina, Ashbourne Laytown-Bettystown, Tullamore, Tramore and Enniscorthy
I have announced today that the smoky coal ban will be extended to 13 more towns, meaning that all towns with populations over 10,000 people will be covered

We must include rented properties in our drive to upgrade 500,000 homes to a more energy efficient standard by 2030, making them warmer & cheaper to run for renters. We have put forward a number of options for consultation today:  https://t.co/rVSQeVhGSO

Delighted to be chairing the 1st meeting of the Global Commission for Urgent Action on energy efficiency. Climate Action Plan commits to 500,000 home upgrades and a new home upgrade model, to group homes together to lower upgrade cost, as well as easy pay back models https://t.co/GU2zITiiEP

Announcing our plan which will start to bring us from 30% to 70% renewable electricity. This, along with our exit from peat and coal to generate electricity, will utterly transform our power system. Vital to achieving our climate targets #ClimateActionPlan https://t.co/8NKZtbLZdg
The RESS has a strong community element with every project developer obligated to contribute to a Community Benefit Fund.

The Renewable Electricity Support Scheme (RESS) is an auction based scheme that allows renewable energy projects bid for capacity on the grid and receive a guaranteed price for the electricity they generate
Ireland is too dependent on fossil fuels and we must radically reduce this dependence and make the transition to cleaner more renewable energy.

Will be on @BreakfastNT & @morningireland this morning to talk about the new Renewable Electricity Support Scheme which will increase the amount of renewables on our grid by 30% over next 3 years. Decarbonizing our electricity supply is a crucial part of the Climate Action Plan

We are taking action on plastics. This year we have also banned govt depts & agencies from buying SUP cups, cutlery & straws; commenced clean oceans initiative to collect & reuse marine litter & commissioned review to see  best way to reach 90% collection for beverage containers https://t.co/kReiB7EH2J
On @kfmradio @highlandradio @kclr96fm and @Galwaybayfmnews this morning to discuss the benefits of the #NationalBroadbandPlan to the 1.1m people living and working in communities across the country

We will be one of the first countries in the world to deliver high speed broadband to every home, farm, school and business. That‚Äôs 1.1 million people who won‚Äôt be left behind https://t.co/BsyPONBR3S via @YouTube

The National Broadband Plan will enable remote monitoring of older and vulnerable people in their homes & will improve home-based care as an alternative to hospitalisation and video medical appointment #NationalBroadbandPlan #ProjectIreland2040

Businesses can look forward to reliable electronic payments and bookings & and the opportunity to create new applications and business models to produce, distribute and sell their goods and services more competitively.

The availability of high speed broadband services will benefit workers through remote working, reduced commuting time and costs and facilitating a greater work-life balance #NationalBroadbandPlan #ProjectIreland2040

New technology is transforming how our young people learn. Every student in Ireland will be able to access digital learning opportunities, with high speed broadband being rolled out to over 600 schools #NationalBroadbandPlan #ProjectIreland2040

Farmers will benefit through smart farming, increasing production quality, allowing remote monitoring of livestock, lower operational costs & better security technology. This will result in better environmental outcomes  & easier interaction with State bodies

Over 300 Broadband Connection Points will be up and running in 2020. These are places where the public can access free high speed internet access at hubs in libraries, community centres, schools, library hubs and local GAA halls in every county in Ireland #NationalBroadbandPlan

This will have a transformative impact on rural Ireland, opening up opportunities in enterprise, health, smart farming to name a few ‚Äì high speed broadband is increasingly becoming a vital utility & today the government is securing access for every person in the country.
Work will begin immediately and over 90% of premises in the State will have access to high speed broadband within the next four years #NationalBroadbandPlan #ProjectIreland2040

The National Broadband Plan is the government‚Äôs plan to rollout high speed broadband to the 1.1M people living & working in the nearly 540,000 premises incl 100,000 businesses and farms, and over 600 schools, where commercial operators will not commit to deliver the service https://t.co/ctIHbyMYgh

This is the biggest investment in rural Ireland since rural electrification. It will ensure rural communities will not be left behind and will be guaranteed the same opportunities as urban areas #NationalBroadbandPlan #Ireland2040

Today is a historic day for rural Ireland. The government are signing the National Broadband Contract, which will bring High-speed broadband to the 1.1M people across Ireland who can‚Äôt get access #NationalBroadbandPlan #Ireland2040

The Government appointed National Broadband Ireland (NBI) as the Preferred Bidder for the NBP in May 2019. Since then officials have been performing the necessary financial and contractual due diligence work needed before a contract can be concluded. This work is progressing

Today‚Äôs decision from the Commission allows the government to proceed towards signing the National Broadband Plan contract with National Broadband Ireland which will commence the roll out of 147,000km of fibre to homes, farms, businesses and schools across our country.

Without broadband it will be significantly more difficult to attract new jobs to rural areas and develop new enterprise opportunities and it will be more difficult to retain the jobs that currently exist in these areas. We will make sure that rural Ireland is not left behind.
It will ensure that the digital revolution happening in education, healthcare, farming and tourism does not bypass rural Ireland.

The National Broadband Plan will deliver high speed broadband to 1.1 million people, almost one quarter of our country. High speed broadband will allow remote working, which can ease congestion and reduce emissions
I welcome today‚Äôs decision by the European Commission to grant state aid approval to the National Broadband Plan  https://t.co/SgeUUJDZCP

Just transition is at the heart of the Government‚Äôs Climate Action Plan. We are here today to listen to those affected and to see first-hand new, sustainable opportunities that the transition to a low carbon economy will open up

@BordnaMona are prioritising 100 new direct jobs and over 150 indirect jobs involved in the development of renewable energy assets by 2023  100 new jobs in new recycling operations  Potentially another 150-300 new jobs in new green business projects
400 jobs direct and indirect will be created to retrofit homes in the Midlands, starting with social homes.   Up to 100 Jobs through the National Parks and Wildlife Service to rehabilitate bogland

Today I am visiting Offaly & Longford with @Paschald @josephamadigan @kevinboxermoran & @MarcellaCK to meet with workers of both @BordnaMona & @ESBNetworks and Unions to discuss Government‚Äôs commitment to Just Transition for the Midlands through new sustainable jobs & industry

In Lough Boora a great example of @BordnaMona bog rehabilitation with my colleague @MarcellaCK Government committed ‚Ç¨5m for bog restoration and rehabilitation in the recent budget including 100 new jobs to restore 1,800 hectares of bog across 7 Midland counties https://t.co/Ok8JlXJLCb

Almost 100 new direct jobs and over 150 indirect jobs to be created by Bord Na M√≥na in the development of renewable energy assets and new recycling operations
200 jobs for Bord Na M√≥na employees transitioning from peat- related operations to be included in the enhanced peatland rehabilitation programme

We will create 400 jobs through a plan to upgrade midlands homes, starting with social homes in the Midlands, and up to 100 jobs through a bog rehabilitation programme led by the Parks and Wildlife Service.
At the heart of the just transition must be job creation and re-training. It must be about creating opportunity for the region for decades to come and to supporting workers

I have appointed Kieran Mulvey as the first Just Transition Commissioner. I am confident that Kieran, with his huge experience in a range of different projects, is ideally placed to become the first Just Transition Commissioner
Engagement on the proposed scheme has been underway with the European Commission and this will continue to be pursued as a matter of priority

We have also been engaging with the European Commission to put in place an extensive Bord na M√≥na bog rehabilitation programme, funded through a re-purposed Public Service Obligation. The programme will rehabilitate 77,000 hectares of bogs to a high standard

Budget 2020 included a number of measures which will be included in the response 1) Just Transition Fund, which ESB are today contributing to, bringing it to ‚Ç¨11m 2) ‚Ç¨5m for bog restoration 3) ‚Ç¨20m for new model to group housing upgrades together

Getting out of peat early will have a significant impact on our emissions -  at least 1.25 million tonnes of carbon saved each year & emissions down by up to 9 million tonnes up to 2027. We must manage this is in a way that ensures the Midlands is supported through the transition
The government are committed to securing long-term, sustainable employment for the Midlands

We are bringing forward a no of initiatives as part of our Just Transition Plan. We prioritized just transition in the recent Budget, incl a number of measures which Kieran Mulvey, in his role as Just Transition Commissioner will now co-ordinate

The government has been working for months to ensure that we fulfill the promise in the Climate Action Plan to deliver a just transition for workers and for regions. I am acutely aware of the impact today's decision will have on workers & the Midlands region more broadly

Local Authorities are uniquely places to drive forward effective climate action at both the regional and local level. Given their pivotal role across the key sectors of planning, housing, transport and waste and their close relationship with the community.
The charter signed today will ensure every local authority embeds decarbonisation, sustainable development and climate resilience into every aspect of the work they do.

Signing a Climate Action charter with all 31 local authorities today. The public sector leading by example is a central pillar of the Climate Action Plan. I am determined that government, both at central and local level, will lead the way on our response to the climate challenge https://t.co/GJkrjxd0cI
It is vital that the voices of young people are heard as we shape decisions for our future.
